reviews.review_msg: David Coley is a FANTASTIC prof! Very spontaneous, engaging, and thorough in his lecture styles. Though he only gave my class one hour sessions, at often times, students complained that they wanted to stick around for another hour. 10/10 would attend another class by this guy. wonderful prof!

David is AMAZING! He's very passionate about what he is teaching, although he tends to get a bit behind on readings (He has A LOT to say). Never a dull moment, I highly recommend this prof. Also, he is hilarious so the class is usually roaring with laughter.

i can't imagine having a better English prof. He is so animated and funny.There was not one lecture were I was bored. His assignments are fair and so is the amount of reading you have to do. Take his class... best prof ever.
Very disorganized and lectures are not helpful

Her lectures are not very organized. For this particular semester, half of the syllabus was omitted from the final exam (which is a pain for those who actually studied the omitted part).. and we never got Canvas set-up with the constant change of syllabus. She's passionate about the subject for sure but.. I don't know.

I would never take a class with her ever again.  She's extremely disorganized, and half the things we learned this semester will not be on our final exam.  Nothing she says in class is actually relevant to what we are learning, and she spends most of lecture rambling.  Honestly, avoid her if you can.

Anne's lectures caused me to lose interest in the topic. While she knows her stuff she shows a lot of unrelated slides and only said anything interesting and on-topic in the last five minutes of class while everyone was getting ready to leave. Would not recommend taking a class with her unless you absolutely have to. TA's were a big help.

I found her to be very disorganized. She tended to go off on tangents or give lectures that had very little to do with what we were discussing. When I approached her about help for my essay she nay-sayed all ideas until I agreed to hers, then later allowed others to write on the topics she rejected. Very frustrating class.

Anne spends more time showing off her linguistics background than she does lecturing about the readings. She is disorganised and spends much of the lecture on irrelevant tangents. Moreover, when she does lecture about the readings, she offers little to no historical context, making it nigh impossible to follow her.

She's the sweetest, kindest, most caring prof ever...but she's also EXTREMELY disorganized.  It took 2 months to return an assignment (so we were at a disadvantage for writing the term paper).  But, the course material is awesome, and she's amazingly smart--I'd recommend taking the course with her, but DON'T take the tutorial with her.
